member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientCache`1
member.summary: This is the cache used by CommunicationClientFactory base class to store the communication channel's for the replicas or instances of a partition. This is a 2 level cache of Partition Id->Endpoint Address->Client channel. The client channels are maintained as a weak reference and the cache entries whose weak references are not alive are cleaned up periodically.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientCacheEntry`1
member.summary: This represents the cache entry that stores the communication channel to an endpoint of a replica or instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientCacheEntry`1.Semaphore
member.summary: This lock protects the members of the cache entry. Users of the this object should acquire this lock before accessing the properties of the object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientCacheEntry`1.IsInCache
member.summary: The IsInCache and IsCommunicationClientValid properties are used to synchronize the code using the cache client entry and the cache clean up code - to ensure that a valid client isn't cleaned up and also a client entry that is removed from cache is not used by the communication factory.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.TargetReplicaSelector
member.summary: This enumeration specifies how the target replica or instance should be chosen when creating a communication channel for a particular partition.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.TargetReplicaSelector.Default
member.summary: This specifies the default option for this enum. If the service partition is stateful, this indicates that communication channel should be established to the primary replica. If the service partition is stateless, this indicates that the communication channel should be established to a random stateless instance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.TargetReplicaSelector.RandomInstance
member.summary: This specifies the default value of this enum for stateless service partitions. This indicates that the communication channel should be established to a random stateless instance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.TargetReplicaSelector.PrimaryReplica
member.summary: This specifies the default value of this enum for stateful service partitions. This indicates that the communication channel should be established to the primary replica.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.TargetReplicaSelector.RandomReplica
member.summary: For stateful service partitions, this indicates that communication channel can be established for to any replica chosen in random - (i.e) primary or secondary. This is not valid for stateless service partitions

member.name: F:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.TargetReplicaSelector.RandomSecondaryReplica
member.summary: For stateful service partitions, this indicates that communication channel can be established for to any secondary replica chosen in random. This is not valid for stateless service partitions

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionInformation
member.summary: Specifies the class that encapsulates the exception seen on the communication channel and additional information required to handle that exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionInformation.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Instantiates the exception information using the given exception and the default target replica selector.
member.param: The exception that was received

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionInformation.#ctor(System.Exception,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.TargetReplicaSelector)
member.summary: Instantiates the exception information using the given exception and target replica selector.
member.param: The exception that was received
The target replica information

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionInformation.Exception
member.summary: Exception that was seen on the communication channel

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionInformation.TargetReplica
member.summary: The target replica identifier to which the communication channel was established.
member.value: A that specifies gives information about the target replica

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetrySettings
member.summary: Specifies the policy for retrying requests on exceptions in the communication channel between client and service replicas.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetrySettings.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates OperationRetrySettings with default values for the retry settings. The default values for MaxRetryBackoffIntervalOnTransientErrors, NonTransientErrors are 2 seconds. The default value for MaxRetryCount is 10.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetrySettings.#ctor(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates OperationRetrySettings with the supplied settings.
member.param: Specifies the maximum interval to back-off before retrying incase of Transient errors
Specifies the maximum interval to back-off before retrying incase of Non transient errors
Specifies the maximum number of times to retry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetrySettings.MaxRetryBackoffIntervalOnTransientErrors
member.summary: Specifies the maximum interval to back-off before retrying in-case of Transient errors
member.value: Maximum retry interval to back-off on transient errors

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetrySettings.MaxRetryBackoffIntervalOnNonTransientErrors
member.summary: Specifies the maximum interval to back-off before retrying in-case of Non transient errors
member.value: Maximum retry interval to back-off on non transient errors

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetrySettings.DefaultMaxRetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of times to retry.
member.value: Maximum number of times to retry a specific exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientEventArgs
member.summary: Specifies the arguments for the communication client connected/disconnected events handler.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientEventArgs`1
member.summary: Specifies the arguments for the communication client connected/disconnected events handler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientEventArgs`1.Client
member.summary: Communication client for which the event is fired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1
member.summary: Provides the base implementation of ICommunicationClientFactory for creating communication clients to talk to service fabric services. Extend the CommunicationClientFactoryBase class to create communication clients for custom transport implementations. This class maintains a cache of communication clients and attempts to reuse the clients for requests to the same service endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.ServiceResolver
member.summary: Gets the ServicePartitionResolver used by the client factory for resolving the service endpoint.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.ExceptionHandlers
member.summary: Gets the custom exception handlers for handling exceptions on the client to service communication channel.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.TraceId
member.summary: Gets the diagnostics trace identifier for this component.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.#ctor(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.IServicePartitionResolver,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.IExceptionHandler},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the communication client factory.
member.param: Optional ServicePartitionResolver
Optional Custom exception handlers for the exceptions on the Client to Service communication channel
Identifier to use in diagnostics traces from this component

member.name: E:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.ClientConnected
member.summary: Event handler that is fired when the Communication client connects to the service endpoint.

member.name: E:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Event handler that is fired when the Communication client disconnects from the service endpoint.

member.param: Uri of the service to resolve
Key that identifies the partition to resolve
Specifies which replica in the partition identified by the partition key, the client should connect to
Specifies which listener in the endpoint of the chosen replica, to which the client should connect to
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for exceptions that occur when creating the client.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the CommunicationClient() object.

member.summary: Gets or Creates the CommunicationClient for the specified listener name by resolving based on the given previousRsp.
member.param: Previous ResolvedServicePartition value
Specifies which replica in the partition identified by the partition key, the client should connect to
Specifies which listener in the endpoint of the chosen replica, to which the client should connect to
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for exceptions that occur when creating the client.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the CommunicationClient() object.

member.summary: Handles the exceptions that occur in the CommunicationClient when sending a message to the Service
member.param: Communication client
Information about the exception that occurred when communicating with the service.
Specifies the retry policy that should be used for handling the reported exception.
Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is a object that determines how the retry policy for this exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.ValidateClient(`0)
member.summary: Returns true if the client is still valid. Connection oriented transports can use this method to indicate that the client is no longer connected to the service.
member.param: the communication client
member.returns: true if the client is valid, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.ValidateClient(System.String,`0)
member.summary: Returns true if the client is still valid and connected to the endpoint specified in the parameter.
member.param: Specifies the expected endpoint to which we think the client is connected to
the communication client
member.returns: true if the client is valid, false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.CreateClientAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a communication client for the given endpoint address.
member.param: listener address where the replica is listening
Cancellation token
member.returns: The communication client that was created

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.CommunicationClientFactoryBase`1.AbortClient(`0)
member.summary: Aborts the given client

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingResult
member.summary: Specifies the base class for the result from handling an exception during client to service communication.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingRetryResult
member.summary: Specifies the exception handling result when the request from client to service can be retried

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingRetryResult.IsTransient
member.summary: Transient retriable exceptions are those where the communication channel from client to service still exists. Non transient retriable exceptions are those where we need to re-resolve the service endpoint before we retry.
member.value: true indicates that this is a transient retriable exception. false indicates that this is a non transient retriable exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingRetryResult.ExceptionId
member.summary: String that uniquely identifies the exception type.
member.value: Unique id for this exception. This id is used to keep track of the number of times this exception is retried

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingRetryResult.MaxRetryCount
member.summary: Maximum number of times this exception type needs to be retried before giving up. The default value is int.MaxValue

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingRetryResult.RetryDelay
member.summary: The operation should be retried after this delay.
member.value: Time delay after which the operation should be retried

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingRetryResult.#ctor(System.Exception,System.Boolean,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates the ExceptionHandlingRetryResult using the given arguments.
member.param: The exception that needs to be retried.

Indicates if this is a transient retriable exception. Transient retriable exceptions are those where the communication channel from client to service still exists. Non transient retriable exceptions are those where we need to re-resolve the service endpoint before we retry.
The interval to wait before retrying
The maximum number of times the exception given in the exception parameter needs to be retried for.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingRetryResult.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates the ExceptionHandlingRetryResult using the given arguments.
member.param: An identifier for the exception that needs to be retried.

Indicates if this is a transient retriable exception. Transient retriable exceptions are those where the communication channel from client to service still exists. Non transient retriable exceptions are those where we need to re-resolve the service endpoint before we retry.
The interval to wait before retrying
The maximum number of times the exception identified by the exceptionId parameter needs to be retried for.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingRetryResult.#ctor(System.Exception,System.Boolean,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetrySettings,System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiates the ExceptionHandlingRetryResult using the given arguments.
member.param: The exception that needs to be retried.

Indicates if this is a transient retriable exception. Transient retriable exceptions are those where the communication channel from client to service still exists. Non transient retriable exceptions are those where we need to re-resolve the service endpoint before we retry.
The retrySettings from which the interval to wait before retrying is figured out.
The maximum number of times the exception identified by the exceptionId parameter needs to be retried for.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingThrowResult
member.summary: Specifies the exception handling result when the request from client to service cannot be retried

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ExceptionHandlingThrowResult.ExceptionToThrow
member.summary: The exception that should be thrown to the client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.IServicePartitionClient`1
member.summary: Defines the interface for the client that can communicate with replicas of a particular service partition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.IServicePartitionClient`1.ServiceUri
member.summary: Gets the name of the service

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.IServicePartitionClient`1.PartitionKey
member.summary: Gets the key of the partition the client is communicating with.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.IServicePartitionClient`1.TargetReplicaSelector
member.summary: Gets the information about which replica in the partition the client should connect to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.IServicePartitionClient`1.ListenerName
member.summary: Gets the name of the listener in the replica to which the client should connect to.

member.summary: Gets the communication client factory

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.IServicePartitionClient`1.TryGetLastResolvedServicePartition(System.Fabric.ResolvedServicePartition@)
member.summary: Gets the resolved service partition that was set on the client.
member.param: previous ResolvedServicePartition
member.returns: true if a ResolvedServicePartition was set

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetryControl
member.summary: Specifies the retry policy for the exceptions got on the communication from client to service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetryControl.ShouldRetry
member.summary: Indicates whether the operation should be retried or not.
member.value: true if the operation should be retried, false if the exception should be thrown to the user

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetryControl.IsTransient
member.summary: If the ShouldRetry property is true, this property indicates if the communication channel between the client and service is still valid. Transient retriable exceptions are those where the communication channel from client to service still exists. Non transient retriable exceptions are those where we need to re-resolve the service endpoint before we retry.
member.value: true indicates that this is a transient retriable exception. false indicates that this is a non transient retriable exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetryControl.RetryDelay
member.summary: The operation should be retried after this delay if the ShouldRetry is true.
member.value: Time delay after which the operation should be retried

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetryControl.ExceptionId
member.summary: String that uniquely identifies the exception type.
member.value: Unique id for this exception. This id is used to keep track of the number of times this exception is retried

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetryControl.MaxRetryCount
member.summary: Max number of times this operation should be retried if the ShouldRetry is true

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.OperationRetryControl.Exception
member.summary: Exception to report for the operation, if ShouldRetry is false. By default this is the same exception as the reported exception, however in some cases the Factory may choose to trasform the reported exception to a more meaningful exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.ServicePartitionClient`1
member.summary: Specifies an instance of the communication client that can communicate with the replicas of a particular partition.

Instantiates a service partition client that uses the specified communication client factory to create a client to talk to the service endpoint identified by the service uri, partitionkey, replica and listener arguments.
member.param: Communication client factory
Name of the service
The partition key used to identify the partition within the service.
Target replica information
Listener in the replica to which the client should connect to
Retry policy for exceptions seen during communication

member.summary: Invokes the given Function, retrying for exceptions thrown other than the exceptions in the doNotRetryExceptionTypes. member.param: Function being invoked

member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result of the Task is the result from the function given in the argument.

member.summary: This method causes the communication listener to close. Close is a terminal state and this method allows the communication listener to transition to this state in a graceful manner.
member.param: Cancellation token
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Runtime.ICommunicationListener.Abort
member.summary: This method causes the communication listener to close. Close is a terminal state and this method causes the transition to close ungracefully. Any outstanding operations (including close) should be canceled when this method is called.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Runtime.ServiceReplicaListener
member.summary: Represents the communication listener and its properties for a Stateful Service replica. Endpoints given out by the communication listener are associated with the name of the communication listener.

summary.para: The default name of the Service replica listener.

value.para: The default name of the Service replica listener.

summary.para: Gets the name of the communication listener.

value.para: The name of the communication listener.

summary.para: Gets the flag that indicates if this communication listener should be opened when the replica becomes an .
When this member is false, the communication listener is opened only when the replica becomes .

value.para: The flag that indicates if this communication listener should be opened when the replica is .

remarks.para: This flag can be set when the primary replica is too busy to serve reads and writes efficiently and the application can tolerate reading stale (but consistent) data, then data can be read from secondary replica.

summary.para: Gets the factory method for creating the communication listener.

value.para: The factory method for creating the communication listener.

remarks.para: The factory method takes in a and returns communication listener implementing .

member.summary:
This method is called when the replica is being opened and it is the final step of opening the service. Override this method to be notified that Open has completed for this replica's internal components.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle
member.param: for this service replica.
Cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceBase.OnChangeRoleAsync(System.Fabric.ReplicaRole,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This method is called when role of the replica is changing and it is the final step before completing . Override this method to be notified that ChangeRole has completed for this replica's internal components.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle
member.param: New for this service replica.
Cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A that represents outstanding operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceBase.RunAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This method is implemented as a processing loop and will only be called when the replica is primary with write status. Override this method with the application logic.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle
member.param: Cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.
member.remarks:
Please ensure you follow these guidelines when overriding :
Make sure passed to is honored and once it has been signaled, exits gracefully as soon as possible. Please note that if has finished its intended work, it does not need to wait for to be signaled and can return gracefully.
Service Fabric runtime does not handle all exception(s) escaping from . If an unhandled exception escapes from , then Service Fabric runtime takes following action(s):
If a (or one of its derived exception) escapes from , Service Fabric runtime will restart this service replica. A health warning will be appear in Service Fabric Explorer containing details about unhandled exception.
If an escapes from and Service Fabric runtime has requested cancellation by signaling passed to , Service Fabric runtime handles this exception and considers it as graceful completion of .
If an escapes from and Service Fabric runtime has NOT requested cancellation by signaling passed to , the process that is hosting this service replica is brought down. This will impact all other service replicas that are hosted by the same process. The details about unhandled exceptions can be viewed in Windows Event Viewer.
If an exception of any other type escapes from then the process that is hosting this service replica is brought down. This will impact all other service replicas that are hosted by the same process. The details about unhandled exceptions can be viewed in Windows Event Viewer.
Failing to conform to these guidelines can cause fail-over, reconfiguration or upgrade of your service to get stuck and can impact availability of your service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceBase.OnCloseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This method is called as the final step of closing the service gracefully. Override this method to be notified that Close has completed for this replica's internal components.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle
member.param: Cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceBase.OnAbort
member.summary:
Notification that the service is being aborted. RunAsync MAY be running concurrently with the execution of this method, as cancellation is not awaited on the abort path.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceBase.OnDataLossAsync(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.RestoreContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method is called during suspected data loss. You can override this method to restore the service in case of data loss.
member.param: A to be used to restore the service.
to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A Task that represents the asynchronous restore operation. True indicates that the state has been restored. False indicates that the replica's state has not been modified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceBase.BackupAsync(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.BackupDescription)
member.summary: Performs a backup of all reliable state managed by this .
member.param: A describing the backup request.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous backup operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceBase.BackupAsync(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.BackupDescription,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Performs a backup of all reliable state managed by this .
member.param: A describing the backup request.
The timeout for this operation.
The cancellation token is used to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous backup operation.
member.remarks: Boolean returned by the backupCallback indicate whether the service was able to successfully move the backup folder to an external location. If false is returned, BackupAsync throws InvalidOperationException with the relevant message indicating backupCallback returned false. Also, backup will be marked as unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceBase.OnDataLossAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This method is called during suspected data-loss.
member.returns: Task that represents the asynchronous operation. True indicates that the state has been restored.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatefulServiceReplicaAdapter.CancelRunAsync

This gets called in three cases:
1) When replica is changing role from primary to secondary. 2) When replica is being closed. 3) When replica is being aborted.

member.summary:
Services that want to implement a background task, which runs when the service comes up, should override this method with their logic.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle
member.param: Cancellation token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation.
member.remarks:
Please ensure you follow these guidelines when overriding :
Make sure passed to is honored and once it has been signaled, exits gracefully as soon as possible. Please note that if has finished its intended work, it does not need to wait for to be signaled and can return gracefully.
Service Fabric runtime does not handle all exception(s) escaping from . If an unhandled exception escapes from , then Service Fabric runtime takes following action(s):
If a (or one of its derived exception) escapes from , Service Fabric runtime will drop this service instance and a new instance will be created. A health warning will be appear in Service Fabric Explorer containing details about unhandled exception.
If an escapes from and Service Fabric runtime has requested cancellation by signaling passed to , Service Fabric runtime handles this exception and considers it as graceful completion of .
If an escapes from and Service Fabric runtime has NOT requested cancellation by signaling passed to , the process that is hosting this service instance is brought down. This will impact all other service instances that are hosted by the same process. The details about unhandled exceptions can be viewed in Windows Event Viewer.
If an exception of any other type escapes from then the process that is hosting this service instance is brought down. This will impact all other service instances that are hosted by the same process. The details about unhandled exceptions can be viewed in Windows Event Viewer.
Failing to conform to these guidelines can cause fail-over, reconfiguration or upgrade of your service to get stuck and can impact availability of your service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Runtime.StatelessService.OnCloseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This method is called as the final step of closing the service. Override this method to be notified that Close has completed for this instance's internal components.
For information about Reliable Services life cycle please see https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-lifecycle

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.ServiceNameFormat

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.ServiceNameFormat.GetEndpointName(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the default endpoint resource name for the given service type
member.param: Service interface type name.
member.returns: The name of the endpoint resource.

list.item: If the type name is IMyService, this method returns MyServiceEndpoint as the name of the endpoint resource.
If the type name is Foo, this method returns FooServiceEndpoint as the name of the endpoint resource.

summary.para: Defines the interface for the Service partition resolver. Service resolution is the process of looking up the set of endpoints for the replicas in a partition. A service partition resolver implements the logic for service resolution.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.IServicePartitionResolver.ResolveAsync(System.Uri,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionKey,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Resolves a partition of the specified service with specified back-off/retry settings on retry-able errors.
member.param: Name of the service instance to resolve.

param.name: partitionKey
param.para: Key that determines the target partition of the service instance. The partitioning scheme specified in the key should match the partitioning scheme used to create the service instance.

member.param: The time out per resolve try.
The interval to back-off before retrying the resolution after a failure due to retry-able exception.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: The CancellationToken that this operation is observing. It is used to notify the operation that it should be canceled.

member.returns: A Task that represents the outstanding service resolution operation. The result from the Task is the object, that contains the information about the resolved service partition including the service endpoints.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.IServicePartitionResolver.ResolveAsync(System.Fabric.ResolvedServicePartition,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

summary.para: Re-resolves a previously resolved partition of the specified service with specified back-off/retry settings on retry-able errors. This method overload is used in cases where the client knows that the resolved service partition that it has is no longer valid.

member.param: The resolved service partition that the client got from the earlier invocation of the ResolveAsync() method.
The time out per resolve try.
The interval to back-off before retrying the resolution after a failure due to retry-able exception.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: The CancellationToken that this operation is observing. It is used to notify the operation that it should be canceled.

member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding service resolution operation. The result from the Task is the object, that contains the information about the resolved service partition including the service endpoints.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionResolver.#ctor(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.CreateFabricClientDelegate,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.CreateFabricClientDelegate)

summary.para: Instantiates a ServicePartionResolver, invoking the first delegate to get the FabricClient.. During partition resolution if FabricClient object gets disposed and second delegate is provided, it uses the second delegate to get the FabricClient again. The second delegate provides a way to specify an alternate way to get or create FabricClient if FabricClient created with first delegate get disposed.

member.param: Delegate to create the fabric client.
Delegate to re-create the fabric client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionResolver.ResolveAsync(System.Uri,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionKey,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

summary.para: Resolves a partition of the specified service by invoking FabricClient's method. This uses the default settings for timeout and back-off retry intervals.

member.param: Name of the service instance to resolve.

param.name: partitionKey
param.para: Key that determines the target partition of the service instance. The partitioning scheme specified in the key should match the partitioning scheme used to create the service instance.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: The CancellationToken that this operation is observing. It is used to notify the operation that it should be canceled.

member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result from the task is the object, that contains the information about the resolved service partition including the service endpoints.

exception.para: This method can throw a FabricServiceNotFoundExcepion if there is no service instance in the cluster matching the specified serviceUri.

This method can throw a FabricException if the scheme specified in the ServicePartitionKey doesn't match the scheme used to create the service instance. See also Errors and Exceptions for handling common FabricClient failures.

remarks.para: This method retries on all transient exceptions. For cases where you want to limit the max execution time of this method, you should create a cancellation token associated with that max execution time and pass that cancellation token to this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionResolver.ResolveAsync(System.Uri,Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionKey,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Resolves a partition of the specified service by invoking FabricClient's method with the given timeout and back-off/retry on retry-able errors.
member.param: Name of the service instance to resolve.

param.name: partitionKey
param.para: Key that determines the target partition of the service instance. The partitioning scheme specified in the key should match the partitioning scheme used to create the service instance.

member.param: The timeout passed to FabricClient's method.

param.name: maxRetryBackoffInterval
param.para: The max interval to back-off before retrying when FabricClient's method fails with a retry-able exception. The actual back off interval is a random time interval which is less than or equal to the specified maxRetryBackoffInterval.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: The CancellationToken that this operation is observing. It is used to notify the operation that it should be canceled.

member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result from the task is the object, that contains the information about the resolved service partition including the service endpoints.

exception.para: This method can throw a FabricServiceNotFoundExcepion if there is no service instance in the cluster matching the specified serviceUri.
This can throw a FabricException if the scheme specified in the ServicePartitionKey doesn't match the scheme used to create the service instance. See also Errors and Exceptions for more information.

remarks.para: This method retries on all transient exceptions. For cases where you want to limit the max execution time of this method, you should create a cancellation token associated with that max execution time and pass that cancellation token to this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionResolver.ResolveAsync(System.Fabric.ResolvedServicePartition,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Resolves a partition of the specified service by invoking FabricClient's method with back-off/retry on retry-able errors. This takes in the resolved service partition that was got via an earlier invocation of the ResolveAsync() method. This method overload is used in cases where the client knows that the resolved service partition that it has is no longer valid.
member.param: The resolved service partition that the client got from the earlier invocation of the ResolveAsync() method.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: The CancellationToken that this operation is observing. It is used to notify the operation that it should be canceled.

member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result from the task is the object, that contains the information about the resolved service partition including the service endpoints.

exception.para: This method can throw a FabricServiceNotFoundExcepion if the service which was resolved previously is no longer present in the cluster.

remarks.para: This method retries on all transient exceptions. For cases where you want to limit the max execution time of this method, you should create a cancellation token associated with that max execution time and pass that cancellation token to this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionResolver.ResolveAsync(System.Fabric.ResolvedServicePartition,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Resolves a partition of the specified service by invoking FabricClient's method with back-off/retry on retry-able errors. This takes in the resolved service partition that was got via an earlier invocation of the ResolveAsync() method. This method overload is used in cases where the client knows that the resolved service partition that it has is no longer valid.
member.param: The resolved service partition that the client got from the earlier invocation of the ResolveAsync() method.
The timeout passed to FabricClient's method

param.name: maxRetryBackoffInterval
param.para: The max interval to back-off before retrying when FabricClient's method fails with a retry-able exception. The actual back off interval is a random time interval which is less than or equal to the specified maxRetryBackoffInterval.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.para: The CancellationToken that this operation is observing. It is used to notify the operation that it should be canceled.

member.returns: A Task that represents outstanding operation. The result from the task is the object, that contains the information about the resolved service partition including the service endpoints.

exception.para: This method can throw a FabricServiceNotFoundExcepion if the service which was resolved previously is no longer present in the cluster.

remarks.para: This method retries on all transient exceptions. For cases where you want to limit the max execution time of this method, you should create a cancellation token associated with that max execution time and pass that cancellation token to this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionResolver.SetDefault(Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionResolver)
member.summary: Updates the default ServicePartitionResolver.
member.param: The new default value

member.name: M:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Client.ServicePartitionResolver.GetDefault
member.summary:
Gets the default ServicePartitionResolver.
The default service partition resolver instance uses the local fabric client. If you are using the ServicePartitionResolver to resolve services that are running on a remote cluster, the recommended practice is to create a ServicePartitionResolver using the appropriate endpoints or FabricClient and then update the default ServicePartitionResolver.
member.returns: Default

member.summary: This is how VB Anonymous Types combine hash values for fields.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.Error_ConnectionDenied
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Client is Not authorized to connect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorCommunicationTargetSelectorEndpointNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No endpoint found for the service '{0}' partition '{1}' that matches the specified TargetReplicaSelector : '{2}'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorCommunicationTargetSelectorInvalidStateful
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The value '{0}' of targetReplicaSelector argument is not a valid for a stateful service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorCommunicationTargetSelectorInvalidStateless
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The value '{0}' of targetReplicaSelector argument is not valid for a stateless service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorConfigFileNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Config File was Not Found in this path {0}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorConfigPackageNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to ConfigPackageName {0} was not found..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorInvalidAddress
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Client is trying to connect to invalid address {0}..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorInvalidPartitionEndpointAddress
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The EndpointAddress '{0}' for partition '{1}' is not in a format understood by the client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorListenerAlreadyExists
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Listener with Name '{0}' already exists. When multiple communication listeners are used, a unique name should be specified for each listener..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorListenerNameNotSpecified
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unique Name must be specified for each listener when multiple communication listeners are used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorPartitionNamedEndpointNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to NamedEndpoint '{0}' not found in the address '{1}' for partition '{2}'.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorParttionInstanceInvalidAddress
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The primary or stateless instance for the partition '{0}' has invalid address, this means that right address from the replica/instance is not registered in the system..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorSectionNameNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to SectionName {0} was Not Found in the Settings File.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorServiceDoesNotExist
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Service '{0}' doesnot exist.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorServiceMethodDispatcher_InterfaceNotFound
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Interface id {0} is not implemented by object {1}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.ErrorServiceTooBusy
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This can happen if message is dropped when service is busy or its long running operation and taking more time than configured Operation Timeout..

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatefulRunAsyncCancellation
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RunAsync has been cancelled for a stateful service replica. The cancellation will be considered 'slow' if RunAsync does not halt execution within {6} milliseconds. Application Type Name: {0}, Application Name: {1}, Service Type Name: {2}, Service Name: {3}, Partition Id: {4}, Replica Id: {5}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatefulRunAsyncCompletion
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RunAsync has successfully completed for a stateful service replica. Application Type Name: {0}, Application Name: {1}, Service Type Name: {2}, Service Name: {3}, Partition Id: {4}, Replica Id: {5}, WasCancelled: {6}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatefulRunAsyncFailure
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RunAsync has failed for a stateful service replica. Application Type Name: {0}, Application Name: {1}, Service Type Name: {2}, Service Name: {3}, Partition Id: {4}, Replica Id: {5}, WasCancelled: {6}, Exception: {7}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatefulRunAsyncInvocation
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RunAsync has been invoked for a stateful service replica. Application Type Name: {0}, Application Name: {1}, Service Type Name: {2}, Service Name: {3}, Partition Id: {4}, Replica Id: {5}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatefulRunAsyncSlowCancellation
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RunAsync was slow to respect the cancellation token and halt execution for a stateful service replica. Application Type Name: {0}, Application Name: {1}, Service Type Name: {2}, Service Name: {3}, Partition Id: {4}, Replica Id: {5}, Time to Cancel: {6} milliseconds, Slow Cancellation Timeout: {7} milliseconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatelessRunAsyncCancellation

The cancellation will be considered 'slow' if RunAsync does not halt execution within {6} milliseconds. Application Type Name: {0}, Application Name: {1}, Service Type Name: {2}, Service Name: {3}, Partition Id: {4}, Instance Id: {5}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatelessRunAsyncCompletion
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RunAsync has successfully completed for a stateless service instance. Application Type Name: {0}, Application Name: {1}, Service Type Name: {2}, Service Name: {3}, Partition Id: {4}, Instance Id: {5}, WasCancelled: {6}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatelessRunAsyncFailure

member.name: P:Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.SR.event_StatelessRunAsyncInvocation
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RunAsync has been invoked for a stateless service instance. Application Type Name: {0}, Application Name: {1}, Service Type Name: {2}, Service Name: {3}, Partition Id: {4}, Instance Id: {5}.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RunAsync was slow to respect the cancellation token and halt execution for a stateless service instance.
